description.narrative: By providing financial support to GC Prim, IFC directly supports: - the retention of jobs for local staff in an IDA country with limited alternative employment prospects; - a sustainable local glass packaging industry player to continue its operations in a financially sustainable manner, that would also have positive effect on the beverage production sector in Moldova; - the competitiveness of a successful exporter in an IDA country. Furthermore, by facilitating the partial reduction of the outstanding MAIB loan by proposed USD 5 million, IFC would enable MAIB to: - comply with the recently tightened single-client exposure limitations of the Central Bank of Moldova; - free-up additional capital to be redeployed domestically to a broader base of borrowers, including many SMEs.

Located in Chisinau, Moldova, Glass Container Prim S.A. (GC Prim or the Company) is an early-stage flint glass investment, which was established as the sister company of the leading Moldovan glass packaging producer, Glass Container Company (GCC). While GCC specializes in the production of colored glass packaging products, in light of the historical demand observed by the GCC management for flint (i.e. transparent) glass packaging products, and due to increased customer focus on quality, two of GCCs largest shareholders decided to launch a new investment in the high-quality flint glass segment under a new legal entity, that became GC Prim. Construction process of GC Prim was finalized in May 2010, when GC Prim opened the new glass plant with a total capacity of 65,000 tones of finished goods per annum (rough equivalent of 130 million bottles). At this juncture, during the ramp-up stage of operations, additional financial resources are needed for GC Prim in order to strengthen the capital structure of the Company, to refinance part of its existing loans, to provide working capital and to fund capital expenditure requirements of the Company (the Project).

name.narrative: GC Prims production facility is located in Chisinau, Republic of Moldova. With a brand new melting furnace (supplied by Techglass, Poland) and two Emhart (Sweden) production lines put in operation in May 2010, GC Prims high quality flint glass production complements the range of bottles and jars produced by GCC in its production facility, which is located at the same industrial campus.
